block.p: Jill A. Davis and Edward Walter Conard were married yesterday by the Rev. Susannah Smith at St. James's Church in New York.

The bride, 33, a comedy writer, is keeping her name. She wrote for David Letterman's programs on NBC and CBS from 1991 to 1997. She is writing a movie for HBO and a novel under contract to Random House. She graduated from Endicott College. She is a daughter of Jane Leader Bruns of Laguna Niguel, Calif., who is an interior designer there.
Jill A. Davis and Edward Walter Conard were married yesterday by the Rev. Susannah Smith at St. James's Church in New York.

The bride, 33, a comedy writer, is keeping her name. She wrote for David Letterman's programs on NBC and CBS from 1991 to 1997. She is writing a movie for HBO and a novel under contract to Random House. She graduated from Endicott College. She is a daughter of Jane Leader Bruns of Laguna Niguel, Calif., who is an interior designer there.

The bridegroom, 43, is a managing director in the New York office of Bain Capital, for which he raises investment money and looks for companies to buy. He graduated from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor and received an M.B.A. from Harvard University. He is a member of the board of the Museum of Science in Boston. He is the son of Barbara and Henry Conard of West Bloomfield, Mich. His father retired as a mechanical engineer for the Ford Motor Company in Dearborn, Mich.
